newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma, long-end of forward curve edges higher.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma, long-end of forward curve edges higher.

text.p: Greek depos were holding and the long-end of the forward curve was slightly up on Thursday as players sought funding for CPI-indexed bonds to be issued May 19, dealers said.
Ecu/drachma was slightly higher, trading around 309.70/75 in late dealings on light buying of ecus for drachmas from Spain and other countries to close out positions.
"Depos are frozen but forex forwards are slightly up in nine- and 12-month tenors on funding for CPI-indexed bonds," said a trader at a private bank.
Greece will issue 4.0 percent, five- and 10-year CPI-indexed bonds on May 19 and 12-month T-bills on June 2, said deputy Finance Minister Nickos Christodoulakis.
The Treasury will also auction about 150 billion drachmas of 10-year fixed coupon bonds in mid-June, the minister said.
Some bond dealers reported strong buying interest from domestic institutionals and foreign players but others said bond prices were little changed and trading was normal.
Consumer price inflation eased to 5.9 percent year-on-year in April from 6.0 percent in March, the National Statistics Service (NSS) said in a statement.
The mark was quoted at 158.86/91 from Thursday's 159.070 fix, the dollar at 271.96/06 drachmas from 272.300 and the ecu at 309.58/68 from 309.600 drachmas.
